results.title: Joan the woman
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and Cardinal Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An English soldier on the Western front in WWI dreams of the Maid of Orleans, Joan of Arc, before he goes into battle. De Mille emphasised the mystical reincarnation theme that appeared in MacPherson’s story by superimposing images of a prophetic angel over the main narrative. He also experimented with a new colour process for the recurrent images of fire. It was charismatic opera diva Geraldine Farrar’s second film with DeMille, made the year after the success of ‘Carmen’ and was the director’s first foray into costume drama. Cast includes Geraldine Farrar, Wallace Reid, Theodore Roberts, Raymond Hatton, Hobart Bosworth. From the story by Jeanie MacPherson. Original 1916 score performed by Christian Elliot.

results.title: Centre stage = Center stage (Collector's edition)
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Hytner, Laurence Mark and Columbia Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: In this teen ensemble drama, the fortunes of several young ambitious dancers are determined over one year’s tuition in a prestigious New York dance school, as they compete for just a few contested places. Jody is the sweet natured ingenue outclassed by the elite students of the school; Maureen is the child protegee dealing with bulimia and a domineering stage mum; Eva is the African-American rebel seeking validation from her peers. The students struggle with the demands of the school and their personal relationships that at times threaten to thwart the achievement of their exacting goal. Most characters are drawn from stock stereotypes (from the “Fame” repertoire), but the drama is affective in its evocation of the young protagonists’ qualms about their uncertain future. Real dancers play most of the main characters, which explains some of the wooden acting, and although the narrative progression is far from unpredictable, the dance sequences are quite stunning and fun to watch. The narrative also touches on body image among female dancers and old style choreography and teaching methods, versus a modern approach. Cast includes: Amanda Schullm, Zoe Saldana, Susan May Pratt, Donna Murphy, Debra Monk, Ethan Stiefel, Sascha Radetsky.

results.title: Mortal thoughts
results.creator_credit: Alan Rudolph, John Fiedler, Joseph Caracciolo Jr, Mark Tarlov, New Visions Pictures, Polar Film and Rufglen Films
results.brief_description: Cynthia and Joyce are childhood friends who get involved in the gruesome death of Joyce’s abusive husband in a moment of passion. The two conspire to cover up the crime, which leads to an intricate web of lies and a cycle of accusations and double-crossings. Alan Rudolph plays out this neo-noir drama within a working class milieu, replete with New Jersey accents and drab surrounds. Demi Moore and Glenne Headly are two hairdressers caught between the loyalties that their lifelong friendship demands and the terror of being accused of murder. Headly gives an absorbing performance as Joyce, a woman trapped in an impoverished, miserable state with an overbearing, insensitive, drunkard of a husband. Harvey Keitel plays a hard-boiled detective who unravels the mystery of James’ death by interrogating Cynthia, who reveals the past through a series of extensive flashbacks.

results.title: Sneakers
results.creator_credit: Phil Alden Robinson, Lawrence Lasker, Lindsley Lindsley Parsons, Walter Parkes and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Martin Bishop heads an organisation of computer hackers, technology experts, reformed thieves and outsiders who are paid to break into high-security institutions in order to prove their vulnerability. Several shady characters approach Martin to steal an electronic code-breaker that is a risk to national security. Against his instincts Martin accepts the assignment when they threaten to expose his true identity. Naturally nothing goes to plan, and the friends find themselves in peril when they realise the decoder’s awesome potential for destruction. What transpires is a thriller entailing conspiracy theories, double-crossings, a corrupt government and murder. “Sneakers” is quite amusing and, at times, somewhat fraught with tension, as the team battle a myriad of forces. Pre-dating the late 1990s, early 2000s paranoid computer-hacker films, “Sneakers” has a sprightliness that impresses and despite an overabundance of contrivances, makes for a satisfying caper. Top cast includes Robert Redford, Sidney Poitier, Ben Kingsley, Dan Ackroyd, Mary McDonnell, River Phoenix and David Strathairn.

results.title: Wolf
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Douglas Wick and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Publisher Will Randall - recently retrenched and replaced by younger, sycophant protegee Stewart (James Spader) - notices strange behaviour after a wolf at full moon bites him. The behaviour involves a heightening of the senses and rejuvinates his lagging demeanor, turning him into a younger version of himself. The metamorphosis reaches full flight at the next half moon when he takes a moonlit wander and awakes in the morning covered in blood and unaware of his actions. Medical science is unable to find an answer to his symptoms, however Dr Vijay Alezias (Om Puri) tells Will he is assuming the characteristics of a werewolf, the crucial point being that Randall can only change if he already possesses the animal instinct. He finds a sympathetic ear to his predicament from his former employer’s beautiful young daughter Laura (Michelle Pfeiffer), whom he is entrusted with protecting after Stewart joins him as a werewolf but doesn’t have the love of a good woman to quell his animal appetite. A hirsute love story, part comedy, part horror, the cast also includes Christopher Plummer, Prunella Scales, Kate Nelligan and David Hyde Pierce and features an impressive gothic mise-en-scene and evocation of the New York publishing scene.

results.title: Ghosts of Mars (Collector's edition)
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Sandy King and Screen Gems
results.brief_description: In 2176 AD humans have been colonizing and mining the planet Mars for years. It is still a desolate place, a matriarchal society populated by 640,000 colonists and protected by the Mars Police Force (MPF). The film is told in flashback by head strong, drug addicted Lieutenant Melanie Ballard (Natasha Henstridge), who is found hand cuffed to an unmanned train that returns to camp minus its crew. Ballard was part of a MPF troupe enlisted to transfer prisoner James “Desolation” Williams (Ice Cube) from Shining Canyon to Chryse City. When they reach their destination however, Ballard and her fellow crew members: Commander Braddock (Pam Grier), Butler (Jason Statham), Kincaid (Clea DuVall) and Uno (Liam Waite), find the place abandoned and everyone dead, hung upside down and decapitated, a crime with which Williams has been accused in the past but has an alibi for this time. Closer inspection reveals the survival of not only Williams, but also Doctor Arlene Whitlock, 2 other prisoners, and a growing posse of possessed “creatures”, original inhabitants of the planet whose ghosts escaped when Whitlock opened Pandora’s Box. Police and prisoners band together to fight an enemy of Martian spirits against a bleak and blood stained backdrop (shot on location on a gypsum mine near Albuquerque, New Mexico), an industrial soundtrack blasting in the background.

results.title: The Big hit [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Che-Kirk Wong, Warren Zide, Wesley Snipes and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Mark Wahlberg stars as an anxiety ridden killer for hire who is part of an elite team of hitmen (made up of Lou Diamond Philips, Antonio Sabato Jr. and Bokeem Woodbine) in this violent action comedy. Wahlberg’s chaotic domestic life and stressful blood soaked professional life come unstuck when the kidnapping of a wealthy businessman’s daughter has major repercussions for the band of killers. From its fetishistic reconstruction of the code and conduct of organized crime, right down to its casual, flippant depictions of violence, “The Big hit” owes a lot to the films of Quentin Tarantino (which are in themselves pastiches of various European and American filmmakers). However the spectre of the Hong Kong action film hangs over them all (“The Big hit” goes as far as enlisting Hong Kong action director Che-Kirk Wong and the executive producer is the legendary John Woo), a cinema that is wonderfully inventive with its own form of genre splicing and indirect homage. Cast also includes Christina Applegate, Elliot Gould, Laine Kazan and Avery Brooks.

results.title: The Caine mutiny [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Edward Dmytryk, Stanley Kramer and SGS Corporation
results.brief_description: Captain Queeg (Humphrey Bogart) takes over command of the run down, rusty minesweeper the “U.S.S. Caine” and immediately orders changes to the running of the vessel, against the instincts of the crew and officers. Slowly the changes and restrictions take on a more ominous form as the Captain is seen to be mentally unstable and endangering the lives of his crew with an adherence to order over reason. Told from the perspective of young and idealistic Graduate Ensign Willie Keith (Robert Francis), appointed ship’s Morale Officer by Queeg, but is one of two officers court martialled facing mutiny after they relieve Queeg of his duties when his steadfast adherence to rules imperils the lives of his crew in a typhoon. Nominated for 8 Academy Awards and based on the 1951 Pulitzer Prize winning novel by Herman Wouk. Cast includes: Jose Ferrer, Van Johnson, Fred MacMurray.

results.title: The Day of the jackal [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Woolf, Fred Zimmerman, Universal Productions and Warwick Films
results.brief_description: Based on the best seller by Frederick Forsyth, “The Day of the jackal” is a taut and colourful suspense thriller about the attempt by the right wing OAS to assassinate General De Gaulle. Edward Fox portrays the ruthless, anonymous assassin hired by OAS Chief Colonel Rodin, played by Eric Porter. The cold precision of his preparations is juxtaposed with the plodding efforts of the French authorities to uncover the plot.

results.title: Devil in a blue dress
results.creator_credit: Carl Franklin, Gary Goetzman, Jesse Beaton, Clinica Estetico, Mundy Entertainment and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: In this neo-noir thriller Denzel Washington plays Easy Rawlins, an ex-service man with a shady past, residing in California, who reluctantly agrees to locate the missing girlfriend of a local politician. As the inexpert detective trawls the town looking for Daphne, he spends the night with a black girl who shortly after turns up dead. Rawlins becomes embroiled in trouble whilst trying to avoid a murder charge and locate the elusive Daphne. Faithful recreation of the 1940s setting generates an alluring atmosphere for a typical detective mystery that pays homage to the classic hardboiled detective thrillers of yore and has all the typical hallmarks of the genre: a dogged private eye, voice over narration, shady, omnivorously sexual women, duplicitous clients, brutal cops, and a deep, dark secret at the heart of it all. But “Devil in a blue dress” differentiates itself from standard noir with a tense depiction of racism cultivated by cops, hoods and local folks alike, that permeates the film. Rawlins’s local suburb, a cornucopia of Negro families living happily amidst middle class domesticity, contrasts with the seedy, murky violence of a bloody drug war. Adapted from the novel by African-American crime author Walter Mosley.
